Description: Fragment of a pottery lid (?); thin cream slip on outside; outside decorated with metopal pattern consisting of two sets of thick parallel lines framing a panel taken up by a dot rosette; below, concentric bands in black, added red and white. Hard, fine, yellowish brown clay, Munsell between 7.5YR 7/4 and 7.5YR 6/4 (pink - light brown); few black inclusions.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: Findspot number '18' scratched by Petrie. Rosette dots between tongues are a typical ornament on north ionian plates. Compare with the plate from Naukratis Schlotzhauer & Weber, Naukratis 31 table 8a.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 320)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
